alert.note: Alert for Fresno (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 28 at 4:44PM PDT by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following county, Fresno. * WHEN...Until 645 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 438 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between one half to one inches of rain has fallen. - Additional thunderstorms moving to the advisory area will produce between one half inch to one inches of additional rain. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kerman. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
